data.text: Itâ€™s just shy of 900 miles. Depends how experienced, energetic you are? 70 miles/day x 13 days (incl. one rest day) should do it.

data.text: re you going for the record or are you wanting to stop at every pub on the way ? How fit /experienced are you ? How much time have you got to play with ? It's your call !

data.text: How long is a piece of string?

data.text: Just done it 12 days, scenic quiet route unsupportedâ€¦I wouldnâ€™t want to go faster as nice to enjoy the ride
data.author: Steven Orton

data.text: Are you planning to do it as a cycle ride or a cycle and explore ride? We recently did JOG to Berwick upon tweed over 8 days 440 miles between 40-72 miles a day. Every day was a joy as we stopped and explored the area we were cycling through. We also spent 2 days in Aviemore. Its the best tour we've done and looking forward to doing Berwick to LE at the same leisurely pace.
data.author: Lorna Johnston

data.text: I am un sure as of yet I need to see time difference I need to fit it around holidays at work
data.author: Adam Barnes

data.text: Took me less then 2 days, cycled to the train station (1.5 miles), took train up, stayed in b&b over night, then cycled last few milesâ€¦ the full English breakfast really made the final leg tough ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚
data.author: Steve Owen

data.text:
15 days for me. I did the 1000 mile north to South end of March (sunset 6.30/7.30). Bloody fantastic but if I did it again I'd take a little bit of longer, just to soak up the beautiful Scotland ðŸ¤˜ https://youtu.be/6nEjfJ8EW6g
John O'Groats to Land's End | Solo Bikepacking | March 2022 | Mark's Charity JOGLE | Highlights
youtube.com
data.author: Mark Randlesome

data.text: We came over from Australia in 2016 and took our time for the 1720 km and explored as we went as it would be the only time we expect to cycle the UK and took 4 weeks. There are a myriad of routes you can take and it depends if you only want to ride and not sightsee as well. People often seem to do it in around 10 to 14 days. We use the then CTC (now Cycling UK) to purchase guides to the End to End which had possible routes and listed accommodation along the way. That was invaluable to us.
data.author: Jenny Currie

data.text: I did it in 9 days... I plan doing it again one day but at a much more leisurely pace 9 days didn't really give me the opportunity to take it all in. It was all about the achievement and not the journey.. take as long as you need to enjoy it
data.author: Kenneth Mazey

data.text: Next time, contemplate this: Norway from Nordkapp to Lindesnes
data.author: Rune Nilsen

data.text: Iâ€™m starting on 5th august from lands end Taking 14 days, averaging 65 to 70 miles a day Steady away to enjoy the ride and scenery
data.author: Andrew Senior

data.text: Done it last month. Took Mr 16 days in total. Wild camped 2 nights and then 1 in a travel lodge/premier Inn as you can take your bike in your room. 6 Â½ days from lands end to stoke on trent (where I live), then 10 days to john o groats. 950miles in total. I used Google maps, using the NCN routes and signs mainly.
data.author: Dave Stan Boardman PT

data.text: cheers mate how did you find it
data.author: Adam Barnes

data.text: really enjoyed it mate. Loved the freedom. Had no set miles to achieve, just took it all in. Met some really interesting people along the way, stopped to enjoy the view, food and people. Used alot of canals aswell. Only tricky thing was the weather, its unpredictable, so i just went with it and accepted it each day.
data.author: Dave Stan Boardman PT

data.text: Sounds like a food ride mate
data.author: Adam Barnes

data.text: I'm retired did it last year camping most of the way in 26 days met some great people on the way loved it there are lots of hills though
data.author: Peter Tomlin

data.text: Your all mad but very fit and adventurous excellent
data.author: Jane Galloway

data.text: Depends which route.Map your own shortest route. However long or quick you want it to be, it's your ride
data.author: Annie Mtb North

data.text: We're currently riding it over 12 days at present and due to start day 9 tomorrow with two riding the distance on a tandem. Quite a manageable timescale.
data.author: Matt Plews

data.text: hope weather's good and have fun
data.author: Adam Barnes

data.text: Scotland is freezing! Glad I brought some cold weather kit!
data.author: Matt Plews

data.text: I learnt that the hard way mate. Now always a down jacket and trousers I always ride In shorts no matter what the weather
data.author: Adam Barnes

data.text: My Dad did it in 19 days, camping and hostels. Had a couple of zero days.

data.text: pretty cool story to tell mate
